t: Psalm 69
A Cry of Distress and Imprecation on Adversaries.
For the choir director; according to Shoshannim. A Psalm of David.
Save*pn me, O God, For*ln the waters have threatened my life.
I*ln have sunk in deep mire, and there is no foothold; I*ln have come into deep waters, and a flood overflows me.
I*ln am weary with my crying; my throat is parched; My*ln eyes fail while I wait for my God.
Those*ln who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head; Those*ln who would destroy me are powerful, being wrongfully my enemies; What*ln I did not steal, I then have to restore.
O*ln God, it is You who knows my folly, And*ln my wrongs are not hidden from You.
May*ln those who wait for You not be ashamed through me, O Lord God*s of hosts; May*ln those who seek You not be dishonored through me, O God of Israel,
Because*ln for Your sake I have borne reproach; Dishonor*ln has covered my face.
I*ln have become estranged from my brothers And*ln an alien to my motherâ€™s sons.
For*ln zeal for Your house has consumed me, And*ln the reproaches of those who reproach You have fallen on me.
When*ln I wept in my soul with fasting, It*ln became my reproach.
When*ln I made sackcloth my clothing, I*ln became a byword to them.
Those*ln who sit in the gate talk about me, And*ln I am*i the song of the drunkards.
But*ln as for me, my prayer is to You, O Lord,*s at an acceptable time; O*ln God, in the greatness of Your lovingkindness, Answer*ln me with Your saving truth.
Deliver*ln me from the mire and do not let me sink; May*ln I be delivered from my foes and from the deep waters.
May*ln the flood of water not overflow me Nor*ln the deep swallow me up, Nor*ln the pit shut its mouth on me.
Answer*ln me, O Lord,*s for Your lovingkindness is good; According*ln to the greatness of Your compassion, turn to me,
And*ln do not hide Your face from Your servant, For*ln I am in distress; answer me quickly.
Oh*ln draw near to my soul and*i redeem it; Ransom*ln me because of my enemies!
You*ln know my reproach and my shame and my dishonor; All*ln my adversaries are before You.
Reproach*ln has broken my heart and I am so sick. And*ln I looked for sympathy, but there was none, And*ln for comforters, but I found none.
They*ln also gave me gall for my food And*ln for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
May*ln their table before them become a snare; And*ln when they are in peace, may*i it*i become*i a trap.
May*ln their eyes grow dim so that they cannot see, And*ln make their loins shake continually.
Pour*ln out Your indignation on them, And*ln may Your burning anger overtake them.
May*ln their camp be desolate; May*ln none dwell in their tents.
For*ln they have persecuted him whom You Yourself have smitten, And*ln they tell of the pain of those whom You have wounded.
Add*ln iniquity to their iniquity, And*ln may they not come into Your righteousness.
May*ln they be blotted out of the book of life And*ln may they not be recorded with the righteous.
But*ln I am afflicted and in pain; May*ln Your salvation, O God, set me securely*i on high.
I*ln will praise the name of God with song And*ln magnify Him with thanksgiving.
And*ln it will please the Lord*s better than an ox Or*iln a young bull with horns and hoofs.
The*ln humble have seen it*i and*i are glad; You*ln who seek God, let your heart revive.
For*ln the Lord*s hears the needy And*ln does not despise His who*i are*i prisoners.
Let*ln heaven and earth praise Him, The*ln seas and everything that moves in them.
For*ln God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah, That*ln they may dwell there and possess it.
The*ln descendants of His servants will inherit it, And*ln those who love His name will dwell in it.
